newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh said due to complete Burma repatriation.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh said due to complete Burma repatriation.

text.p: The repatriation of Burmese Moslem refugees living in Bangladesh since 1992 will be completed by March 31, government officials said on Thursday.
They said this was agreed at a meeting of government officials of the two countries in Chittagong on Wednesday.
More than 250,000 Moslems, called Rohingyas, fled to southeastern Bangladesh in early 1992 from Burma's Moslem-majority Arakan province, complaining of persecution by Rangoon's ruling military junta.
Repatriation began in September that year following an agreement between Dhaka and Rangoon, but some 26,000 people are still housed in squalid camps, according to official figures.

U Maung Aung, Director-General of Immigration, headed a 21-member Burmese team at Wednesday's meeting, which also decided to step up efforts to remove other irritants in bilateral relations, one official said without elaborating.
